poem:
The Beginning

In the valley of shadows,
where the clay holds whispers,
a woman, round and ancient,
birthed from godless hands.
Breasts, hips—earth's contours—
the first form, a prayer
not for possession,
but for the void-stretched
womb of creation—
an echo in stone,
misread through time,
as man weaves myths
to harness her light.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Myth and misogyny: how male representations of the female form have changed the way women are viewed In the beginning was woman. The oldest representation of a human we have – the 40,000-year-old “Venus” of Hohle Fels – is an exaggeratedly fertile woman, the first in a series of Paleolithic statues emphasising breasts, broad hips and the vulva. In the earliest stories, the Earth was female and humanity was created by women, from the Chinese". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
